narrative.title: 2Nd South African Division - 1941Q2
narrative.situation: British Infantry Division deployed in North Africa during 1941Q2.
narrative.objectives: Commonwealth infantry division in TRANSITION to Western Desert operations. Q2 1941 mission: April-May (training in South Africa for North African deployment), June (sea deployment to Egypt), late June-August (desert warfare training at El Alamein, defensive works construction). Division formed October 23, 1940 under Maj-Gen de Villiers. NOT operationally deployed in combat during Q2 1941.
narrative.axis_objective: Hold current positions and prevent Allied breakthrough.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and neutralize Axis defensive positions.

weather.terrain: TRANSITIONAL: South Africa training areas (temperate, varied terrain) → Western Desert Egypt (arid, sandy, coastal near El Alamein). Division undergoing desert warfare training late June onwards.

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: Motorized infantry division with good mobility

environment.terrain_type: TRANSITIONAL: South Africa training areas (temperate, varied terrain) → Western Desert Egypt (arid, sandy, coastal near El Alamein). Division undergoing desert warfare training late June onwards.
